answers.answer: The GD test checks the probability and/or existence of gestational diabetes. It's called the O'Sullivan Glucose Tolerance Test. It depends on the OB, the coun7, etc. It involves drinking a sugary drink and then not eating and only drinking water for 1 hour after consumption,  at which point your blood is drawn and sent for analysis. If your levels come back under a certain number,  you pass. If they are high, you have to take a longer,  3 hour test that involves fasting.
No you technically don't have to take it if you don't want. But it is recommended
